segtools-relabel fails with:


```
#!python

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/bin/segtools-relabel", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('segtools===1.1.11.dev-r0', 'console_scripts', 'segtools-relabel')()
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/relabel.py", line 130, in main
    relabel(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/relabel.py", line 87, in relabel
    (segment['strand'] == prev_segment['strand'])
ValueError: no field of name strand
```

In numpy > 1.10 accessing a non-existing field throws a ValueError and not an IndexError.

For now, I have fixed this in my local version:


```
#!python

 31 def get_strand(segment):
 32     try:
 33         return segment['strand']
 34     # IndexError, not KeyError, because segment is a NumPy struct
 35     except IndexError:
 36         return STRAND_UNKNOWN
 37     except ValueError: # horrible hack
 38         return STRAND_UNKNOWN
```

and


```
#!python

 87                     try:
 88                         strands_match = \
 89                             (segment['strand'] == prev_segment['strand'])
 90                     except IndexError:
 91                         strands_match = True
 92                     except ValueError: # horrible hack
 93                         strands_match = True
```
